verses.text: I made a covenant with mine eyes ; why then should I think upon a maid ?
For what portion of God \add is there\add* from above ? and \add what\add* inheritance of the Almighty from on high ?
\add Is\add* not destruction to the wicked ? and a strange \add punishment\add* to the workers of iniquity ?
Doth not he see my ways , and count all my steps ?
If I have walked with vanity , or if my foot hath hasted to deceit ;
Let me be weighed in an even balance , that God may know mine integrity.\f + \fr 31.6 \ft Let…: Heb. Let him weigh me in balances of justice\f*
If my step hath turned out of the way , and mine heart walked after mine eyes , and if any blot hath cleaved to mine hands ;
\add Then\add* let me sow , and let another eat ; yea, let my offspring be rooted out. \p
If mine heart have been deceived by a woman , or \add if\add* I have laid wait at my neighbour’s door ;
\add Then\add* let my wife grind unto another , and let others bow down upon her.
For this \add is\add* an heinous crime ; yea, it \add is\add* an iniquity \add to be punished by\add* the judges.
For it \add is\add* a fire \add that\add* consumeth to destruction , and would root out all mine increase.
If I did despise the cause of my manservant or of my maidservant , when they contended with me;
What then shall I do when God riseth up ? and when he visiteth , what shall I answer him?
Did not he that made me in the womb make him? and did not one fashion us in the womb ?\f + \fr 31.15 \ft did not one…: or, did he not fashion us in one womb?\f* \p
If I have withheld the poor from \add their\add* desire , or have caused the eyes of the widow to fail ;
Or have eaten my morsel myself alone, and the fatherless hath not eaten thereof;
(For from my youth he was brought up with me, as \add with\add* a father , and I have guided her from my mother’s womb ;)\f + \fr 31.18 \ft her: that is, the widow\f*
If I have seen any perish for want of clothing , or any poor without covering ;
If his loins have not blessed me, and \add if\add* he were \add not\add* warmed with the fleece of my sheep ;
If I have lifted up my hand against the fatherless , when I saw my help in the gate :
\add Then\add* let mine arm fall from my shoulder blade , and mine arm be broken from the bone.\f + \fr 31.22 \ft bone: or, chanelbone\f*
For destruction \add from\add* God \add was\add* a terror to me, and by reason of his highness I could not endure. \p
If I have made gold my hope , or have said to the fine gold , \add Thou art\add* my confidence ;
If I rejoiced because my wealth \add was\add* great , and because mine hand had gotten much ;\f + \fr 31.25 \ft gotten…: Heb. found much\f*
If I beheld the sun when it shined , or the moon walking \add in\add* brightness ;\f + \fr 31.26 \ft sun: Heb. light\f*\f + \fr 31.26 \ft in…: Heb. bright\f*
And my heart hath been secretly enticed , or my mouth hath kissed my hand :\f + \fr 31.27 \ft my mouth…: Heb. my hand hath kissed my mouth\f*
This also \add were\add* an iniquity \add to be punished by\add* the judge : for I should have denied the God \add that is\add* above.
If I rejoiced at the destruction of him that hated me, or lifted up myself when evil found him:
Neither have I suffered my mouth to sin by wishing a curse to his soul.\f + \fr 31.30 \ft mouth: Heb. palate\f*
If the men of my tabernacle said not, Oh that we had of his flesh ! we cannot be satisfied.
The stranger did not lodge in the street : \add but\add* I opened my doors to the traveller.\f + \fr 31.32 \ft traveller: or, way\f* \p
If I covered my transgressions as Adam , by hiding mine iniquity in my bosom :\f + \fr 31.33 \ft as Adam: or, after the manner of men\f*
Did I fear a great multitude , or did the contempt of families terrify me, that I kept silence , \add and\add* went not out of the door ?

Oh that one would hear me! behold, my desire \add is, that\add* the Almighty would answer me, and \add that\add* mine adversary had written a book.\f + \fr 31.35 \ft my…: or, my sign is that the Almighty will\f*
Surely I would take it upon my shoulder , \add and\add* bind it \add as\add* a crown to me.
I would declare unto him the number of my steps ; as a prince would I go near unto him.
If my land cry against me, or that the furrows likewise thereof complain ;\f + \fr 31.38 \ft complain: Heb. weep\f*

If I have eaten the fruits thereof without money , or have caused the owners thereof to lose their life :\f + \fr 31.39 \ft fruits: Heb. strength\f*\f + \fr 31.39 \ft the owners…: Heb. the soul of the owners thereof to expire, or, breathe out\f*
Let thistles grow instead of wheat , and cockle instead of barley. The words of Job are ended.\f + \fr 31.40 \ft cockle: or, noisome weeds\f*
